properties.areaDesc: Madison; Northern Jackson; Buncombe; Haywood; Graham; Mitchell; Swain; Avery; Yancey
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 6:13PM EST until January 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...LIGHT ACCUMULATING SNOW TO CONTINUE ALONG THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
AND NEAR THE TENNESSEE BORDER THROUGH LATE EVENING.

.As an upper-level disturbance moves east of the southern
Appalachians tonight, the focus for additional accumulating
snowfall will be at the higher elevations mainly along and near
the Tennessee border. The snow will taper off and become lighter
through the overnight hours, and be confined mainly to the
northern mountains by daybreak Tuesday.

* WHAT...Snow continuing. Additional snow accumulations ranging
from a dusting above 3500 feet to two inches above 4500 feet.

* WHERE...Elevations above 3500 feet in Avery, Madison, Yancey,
Mitchell, Swain, Haywood, Buncombe, Graham, and northern Jackson
Counties in western North Carolina.

* WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions may impact the commute on Tuesday morning as
subfreezing temperatures linger.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Please report snow and ice accumulations by calling the National
Weather Service toll free at...1...800...2 6 7...8 1 0 1. Leave a
message with your observation and the specific location where it
occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather
Service Greenville Spartanburg Facebook or tweet your report
using hashtag nwsgsp.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of
weather information for the latest updates. Additional details
can be found at www.weather.gov/gsp.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST TUESDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET
